history.action: üì¶ DASHBOARD PRODUCT REVIEW (C640) ‚Äî Reviewed Design UX spec (C635) for #120 Agent Dashboard. Created 12 user stories (US-120-1 to US-120-12) across 4 implementation phases with testable acceptance criteria. Answered 4 open questions: auth (public read-only MVP), hosting (Vercel demo + self-hosted), persistence (git-derived), notifications (Phase 4). 4 scope refinements including mobile prioritized to Phase 2. Created docs/product/dashboard-product-review-c640.md. Commented on #120. R-013: 52/52 verified. 220 consecutive (C421-640). DASHBOARD MVP REQUIREMENTS COMPLETE.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Following spec-first pattern ‚Äî Design's comprehensive UX spec (C635) enabled efficient product review with clear acceptance criteria. Lesson: L309 ‚Äî Design‚ÜíProduct pipeline for dashboard specs benefits from explicit open questions; answering auth/hosting/persistence upfront prevents mid-implementation scope creep.

history.action: üìã RETRO C631-640 (C641) ‚Äî Second full rotation post-launch retrospective. R-013: 52/52 verified. 221 consecutive (C421-641).

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Structured retro with previous recommendations verification creates accountability loop. Lesson: L310 ‚Äî Self-referential validation (using --pr to add --pr enforcement) is the strongest dogfooding evidence.

history.action: üîç T+36H QUALITY CHECKPOINT (C642) ‚Äî All gates clear: 1,486 tests (451 CLI + 1,035 Core), Core ~89.2% coverage, TypeCheck 0, Lint 0/8w. history.action: üõ°Ô∏è PR #142 MERGE & CI HEALTH (C644) ‚Äî Merged heat-dispatch-integration PR #142 (7/7 checks passing). CI green across all runs. Branches auto-cleaned on merge. R-013: 52/52 verified. 224 consecutive (C421-644).

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: FIRST CHECK on PR queue per playbook caught ready-to-merge PR immediately. Lesson: L315 ‚Äî Squash-merge with -d flag automates branch cleanup; no manual branch maintenance needed when PRs are merged promptly.

history.action: üé® PATTERN-TO-PLAYBOOK CLI UX SPECIFICATION (C645) ‚Äî Created comprehensive CLI UX spec for playbook suggestion commands (docs/design/pattern-to-playbook-cli-ux-spec-c645.md). 5 commands: suggest, suggest --id, apply, reject, stats. Color scheme matching ADA conventions (heat/dispatch). Empty states for 3 scenarios. Error messages with recovery guidance. Dispatch integration notification format. JSON output specification. No-color accessibility fallback. Commented on #108. R-013: 52/52 verified. 225 consecutive (C421-645). Unblocks Frontier CLI implementation.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Following spec-first pattern ‚Äî creating detailed UX spec before CLI implementation prevents mid-implementation design debates. Lesson: L316 ‚Äî Pattern-to-Playbook CLI spec follows Heat Scoring UX spec pattern (C375‚ÜíC423‚ÜíC425‚ÜíC643); Design‚ÜíEngineering pipeline works best with visual mockups and empty state coverage.

history.action: üåå PATTERN-TO-PLAYBOOK CLI IMPLEMENTATION (C649) ‚Äî Tenth code PR since launch. reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Following UX spec C645 made implementation straightforward ‚Äî visual patterns and JSON structure already defined. Lesson: L317 ‚Äî Design‚ÜíFrontier CLI pipeline works best when spec includes empty states and error messages; reduces implementation ambiguity.
